moves.1. b3: starting with a fiancetto means I get early control of the center of the board. the trick is keeping it with that pesky bishop.
moves.1... e6 2. Bb2 Nf6 3. e3 c5: I like my black variation. so there. c5 did throw me off a bit, though.
moves.4. Qf3 Be7: I guess i wanted to castle. I forgot the motivation, but it wasn't a bad move, was it?
moves.5... Nxa6 6. Nc3 d5: I was in middle game last move, so it's time to advance.
moves.7. Nb5 Nb4: that knight is simply not a threat at the moment. I wanted an early advance on a2/c2
moves.9... d4: I want that knight gone. (this turns into a knights/bishops later on)
moves.10. Na4: a weak attack, but one I have to take action against.
moves.11. Nf3 O-O: considering that he is extremely underdeveloped (he brought his queen back to d1) I figured this was the best time to castle.
moves.13... Nxc2+ 14. Kf1 Nxa1 15. Qxa1 Qb5+: I shoved the king into a corner. this is called: winning.
moves.17... Qe2 18. Qf1: now that i look back, I shouldve traded queens here. I would then have a free bishop. one day too late.
moves.18... Nc3: take with pawn... take with pawn... take with paaaaaawn.
moves.19. Nxc3: wishful thinking is not a smart tactic. learn from my mistake.
moves.23. Qxa6 Bxa6: queen trade. I should've taken advantage this earlier. oh well.
moves.25. Kg1: another mistake. note how I only have a rook and 2 bishops, and him the same with knights.
moves.26... Bc6 27. d4 Rd8: attack the one last threatening pawn.
moves.28. Rd3 a5 29. a4 f5: I'm not sure what I was going for. I should've just gone with my next move in the first place.
moves.30. f4 Be4: Oh, that's right, I needed the f5 protection, never mind.
moves.31. Rd2 Bb4: resignation by white. He must like that pawn. he can't do anything to save the knight of control of d4, and lost all of his momentum early in the game with the queen's retreating.
